        h - double[] containing convolutional kernel

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        public void filter(double[] transform,
                   double[] dst,
                   int dptr)
        Filtering operation to produce an incremental convolution result from one block of data
        Parameters:
        transform - double[] array containing transform of data block
        dst - double[] containing increment of convolution result - array length must be at least dptr + blockSize
        dptr - Point within destination array where convolution result starts

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initialization - initializes filter state to zero, but does not alter the kernel

      • flush

        public void flush(double[] dst,
                  int dptr)
        Flushes state information buffer - i.e. left over convolution results when no further data blocks are available
        Parameters:
        dst - double[] where convolution results are returned. Length of dst must be >= dptr + blockSize.
        dptr - int specifying point in dst where convolution results begin.

      • getKernelLength

        public int getKernelLength()
